an3.34:4.1: “Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
an3.34:4.3: Greed, hate, and delusion are sources that give rise to deeds.
an3.34:5.1: Any deed that emerges from greed—born, sourced, and originated from greed—ripens where that new life-form is born.
an3.34:5.2: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, on being reborn, or in some future period.
an3.34:6.1: Any deed that emerges from hate—born, sourced, and originated from hate—ripens where that new life-form is born.
an3.34:6.2: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, on being reborn, or in some future period.
an3.34:7.1: Any deed that emerges from delusion—born, sourced, and originated from delusion—ripens where that new life-form is born.
an3.34:7.2: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, on being reborn, or in some future period.
an3.34:8.1: Suppose some seeds were intact, unspoiled, not weather-damaged, fertile, and well-kept. They’re sown in a well-prepared, productive field,
an3.34:8.2: and the heavens provide plenty of rain.
an3.34:8.3: Then those seeds would grow, increase, and mature.
an3.34:8.4: So too, any deed that emerges from greed—born, sourced, and originated from greed—ripens where that new life-form is born.
an3.34:8.5: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, on being reborn, or in some future period.
an3.34:9.1: Any deed that emerges from hate …
an3.34:9.2: Any deed that emerges from delusion—born, sourced, and originated from delusion—ripens where that new life-form is born.
an3.34:9.3: And wherever that deed ripens, its result is experienced—either in the present life, on being reborn, or in some future period.
an3.34:9.4: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.
an3.34:10.1: Mendicants, there are these three sources that give rise to deeds.
an3.34:10.3: Contentment, love, and understanding are sources that give rise to deeds.
an3.34:11.1: Any deed that emerges from contentment—born, sourced, and originated from contentment—is given up when greed is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
an3.34:12.1: Any deed that emerges from love—born, sourced, and originated from love—is abandoned when hate is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
an3.34:13.1: Any deed that emerges from understanding—born, sourced, and originated from understanding—is abandoned when delusion is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
an3.34:14.1: Suppose some seeds were intact, unspoiled, not damaged by wind and sun, fertile, and well-kept.
an3.34:14.2: But someone would burn them with fire,
an3.34:14.4: and winnow the ashes in a strong wind, or float them away down a swift stream.
an3.34:14.5: Then those seeds would be cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
an3.34:14.6: So too, any deed that emerges from contentment—born, sourced, and originated from contentment—is abandoned when greed is done away with. It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
an3.34:15.1: Any deeds that emerge from love …
an3.34:15.2: Any deed that emerges from understanding—born, sourced, and originated from understanding—is abandoned when delusion is done away with.
an3.34:15.3: It’s cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, exterminated, and unable to arise in the future.
an3.34:15.4: These are three sources that give rise to deeds.”
